channel.title: BBC News - Business
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: David Cameron personally promoted Greensill to investors
item.description: BBC Panorama finds Mr Cameron appeared alongside the controversial company's founder at a 2019 event.

item.title: JetBlue to launch NY-UK flights despite pandemic
item.description: The airline says there is "strong demand" for the route as the global travel industry recovers.

item.title: Paddy Power owner revenue soars amid online gambling boom
item.description: Gambling giant Flutter says revenue jumped to £3bn as number of gamblers leaps by 40%.

item.title: Tobacco giant Philip Morris in auction showdown to buy asthma firm
item.description: Philip Morris is locked in a £1bn battle with private equity firm Carlyle over drugmaker Vectura.

item.title: TikTok named as the most downloaded app of 2020
item.description: The Chinese app's popularity comes even after former President Donald Trump tried to ban it in the US.

item.title: Second-hand car sales soar amid shortage of new models
item.description: Used car transactions have more than doubled in the last few months, according to the industry body.

item.title: Anger at overflowing Covid test drop boxes
item.description: Provider Randox says it is increasing collections but the tests for UK arrivals are branded "pointless".

item.title: Apple defends new photo scanning child protection tech
item.description: The tech giant has insisted that its new technology will not be used to spy on its users.

item.title: US job vacancies hit a record 10.1 million
item.description: It comes amid reports the country is still facing a labour shortage in sectors such as labour and hospitality.

item.title: Deliveroo: German rival buys stake in delivery platform
item.description: Delivery Hero's comments about Deliveroo send its shares soaring to new heights since going public.

item.title: China sues Tencent over WeChat Youth Mode
item.description: Authorities allege the messaging app is violating Chinese law that aims to protect minors.

item.title: Groupon told to improve how it treats customers
item.description: The competition watchdog warns the discounter it faces legal action unless it takes 'swift' action.

item.title: Mobile roaming charges in Europe: What you need to know
item.description: How much more will Britons have to pay to use their mobiles in Europe, now the UK has left the EU?

item.title: Vodafone to bring back roaming charges from January
item.description: It follows EE's decision to reintroduce daily charges for using phone tariffs while in Europe

item.title: Ocado Group offers staff remote working abroad
item.description: The tech firm's move covers one month a year as the government says flexible working is "here to stay".

item.title: SFO probes Gavin Woodhouse over suspected care home fraud
item.description: The Serious Fraud Office has launched a fraud investigation into care home entrepreneur Gavin Woodhouse

item.title: Alibaba to sack manager accused of rape, according to memo seen by BBC
item.description: The move comes after a woman's allegations of sexual assault went viral on Chinese social media.

item.title: Saudi oil giant Aramco sees profits soar by almost 300%
item.description: The results were boosted by a rise in oil prices as demand recovers after the pandemic.

item.title: Can technology help authors write a book?
item.description: Writing a novel is notoriously difficult, but technology may give the writer a helping hand.

item.title: The activist entrepreneurs running zero-waste shops
item.description: Environmentally conscious entrepreneurs explain the movement towards zero-waste lifestyles.

item.title: Why artificial intelligence is being used to write adverts
item.description: Advertisers are increasingly using artificial intelligence to come up with their winning slogans.

item.title: Plain sailing: Boating holidays on the rise across the UK
item.description: More people are hiring boats to travel along the UK's canals and rivers amid travel restrictions.

item.title: CEO Secrets: Airbnb boss shares his business advice
item.description: Brian Chesky, co-founder and CEO of Airbnb, shares his business advice for the CEO Secrets series.

item.title: The downfall of Nissan's Carlos Ghosn: An insider's view
item.description: Former Nissan lawyer Ravinder Passi had a ringside seat of the downfall of chairman Carlos Ghosn.

item.title: What is solarpunk and can it help save the planet?
item.description: Solarpunk is art movement that imagines a world where technology is used for the good of the planet.
